fileoperations.projecthandling

Class ProjectHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • fileoperations.projecthandling.ProjectHandler

  • public class ProjectHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is to handle project properties. It can create, save, open and change project properties. It allows to save in one folder and open in another folder.

    Do not forget some file parameters take absolute path or file name, and others takes path after sources path, and project file and sources and build must be in same folder.

    E.g sources path can be "D:/user/workspace/projectX/src" or "src" when project path "D:/user/workspace/projectX/" but main class path must be "packageX/Main.java" or "Main.java". This makes folder changable.
    See Also:
    ProjectProperties

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProjectHandler

        public ProjectHandler(java.io.File build,
                      java.io.File src,
                      java.io.File mainClass,
                      java.lang.String projectPath)
               throws java.lang.SecurityException
        It creates call-IDE project with given parameters. It creates build and src folders unless they exist.
        Parameters:
        build - build folder of project. Its path can be absolute path or just name of build folder. e.g "D:/user/workspace/projectX/classes" or "classes"
        src - sourcefolder of project. Its path can be absolute path or just name of build folder. e.g "D:/user/workspace/projectX/src" or "src"
        mainClass - it is a file of main class. Its path cannot be absolute path. It must be path after src absolute path. e.g "packageX/Main.java" so it comes after src path
        projectPath - path of where project file will be. It should end with "/". e.g "D:/user/workspace/projectX/".
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if can't create src and build

      • ProjectHandler

        public ProjectHandler(java.io.File build,
                      java.io.File src,
                      java.io.File mainClass,
                      java.lang.String projectPath,
                      java.util.ArrayList<java.io.File> allJavaFiles,
                      java.util.ArrayList<java.io.File> externalClassPaths)
               throws java.lang.SecurityException
        It creates call-IDE project with given parameters. It creates build and src folders unless they exist.
        Parameters:
        build - build folder of project. Its path can be absolute path or just name of build folder. e.g "D:/user/workspace/projectX/classes" or "classes"
        src - sourcefolder of project. Its path can be absolute path or just name of build folder. e.g "D:/user/workspace/projectX/src" or "src"
        mainClass - it is a file of main class. Its path cannot be absolute path. It must be path after src absolute path. e.g "packageX/Main.java" so it comes after src path
        projectPath - path of where project file will be. It should end with "/". e.g "D:/user/workspace/projectX/".
        allJavaFiles - list of project files in src
        externalClassPaths - list of the external class paths
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if can't create src and build

      • ProjectHandler

        public ProjectHandler()
        It creates empty project. It may use for open projects. IMPORTANT: project properties will be null!

    • Method Detail

      • saveProject

        public void saveProject(java.lang.String path,
                        java.lang.String name)
                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                        java.io.IOException
        It saves project with given path and given project name.
        Parameters:
        path - it is absolute path to save. It should end with "/". e.g "D:/user/workspace/projectX/".
        name - name of project file. It should not include file extension.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if file not found
        java.io.IOException - if writing fails

      • openProject

        public void openProject(java.lang.String path,
                        java.lang.String name)
                 throws ProjectHandler.FilesMismatchException,
                        java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                        java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        It opens project in given path and given project name.
        Parameters:
        path - it is absolute path to open. It should end with "/". e.g "D:/user/workspace/projectX/".
        name - name of project file. It should not include file extension.
        Throws:
        ProjectHandler.FilesMismatchException - if files that project has mismatch files in src
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if file not found
        java.io.IOException - if reading fails
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if can't found ProjectProperties

      • saveProject

        public void saveProject(java.io.File projectFile)
                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                        java.io.IOException
        It saves project with given path and given project name.
        Parameters:
        projectFile - project file to save.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if file not found
        java.io.IOException - if writing fails

      • openProject

        public void openProject(java.io.File projectFile)
                 throws ProjectHandler.FilesMismatchException,
                        java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                        java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        It opens project in given path and given project name.
        Parameters:
        projectFile - project file to open.
        Throws:
        ProjectHandler.FilesMismatchException - if files that project has mismatch files in src
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if file not found
        java.io.IOException - if reading fails
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if can't found ProjectProperties

        Parameters:

      • setMainClass

        public void setMainClass(java.io.File mainClass)

        Parameters:
        mainClass - it is a file of main class. Its path cannot be absolute path. It must be path after src absolute path. e.g "packageX/Main.java" so it comes after src path

      • setAllJavaFiles

        public void setAllJavaFiles(java.util.ArrayList<java.io.File> allJavaFiles)
        It sets all java files. This is java files that project has. Files path's in ArrayList cannot be absolute path. It must be path after src absolute path. e.g "packageX/HelloWorld.java" so it comes after src path
        Parameters:
        allJavaFiles - list of project files in src
